column1: Then they came to another grove of trees
column2: where all the leaves were of gold; and afterwards to a third
column3: where the leaves were all glittering diamonds. And the soldier broke a branch from each; and every time there was a loud noise
column4: which made the youngest sister tremble with fear; but the eldest still said
column6: who were crying for joy. So they went on till they came to a great lake; and at the side of the lake there lay twelve little boats with twelve handsome princes in them
column7: who seemed to be waiting there for the princesses.One of the princesses went into each boat
column8: and the soldier stepped into the same boat with the youngest. As they were rowing over the lake
column9: the prince who was in the boat with the youngest princess and the soldier said
column10: ‘I do not know why it is
column11: but though I am rowing with all my might we do not get on so fast as usual
column12: and I am quite tired: the boat seems very heavy today.' ‘It is only the heat of the weather
column13: ' said the princess: ‘I feel it very warm too.'
